A terminal is a building where passengers transfer between ground transportation and the facilities that allow them to board and disembark from mass transit vehicles such as buses, trains, and aircraft.

Airports are divided into landside and airside. Landside includes all areas accessible to the general public, while airside includes all areas accessible only to aircraft, airport vehicles and authorized personnel.
Airport terminal is a building at an airport where passengers transfer between ground transportation and the facilities that allow them to board and disembark from aircraft.

Airport terminals are buildings where passengers transfer between ground transportation and the facilities that allow them to board and disembark from an aircraft. Within the terminal, passengers purchase tickets, transfer their luggage, and go through security. The buildings that provide access to the airplanes (via bridges, buses, or walkways) are typically called concourses. However, the terms "terminal" and "concourse" are sometimes used interchangeably, depending on the configuration of the airport.
A terminal is the place at an airport where passengers board or disembark from an aircraft.
